humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that 'TEN (10) REGIONAL LYMPH NODES POSITIVE FOR METASTATIC INVASIVE DUCTAL CARCINOMA' which corresponds to N3 according to Rule 13: N3 indicates metastases in 4 or more axillary lymph nodes. The exact number of positive lymph nodes is 10, which is greater than 4, so the N stage is N3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer staging is determined by the number of lymph nodes involved. In this report, it is stated that 'TEN (10) REGIONAL LYMPH NODES POSITIVE FOR METASTATIC INVASIVE DUCTAL CARCINOMA.' This indicates that the patient has 10 or more positive lymph nodes, which corresponds to an N3 stage. The American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) defines N3 as 'Metastasis in 4 or more axillary lymph nodes, or in clinically detected ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastasis.' In this case, the report mentions axillary lymph nodes, so the N3 stage is confirmed.
